Journal.Title: Analytical methods : advancing methods and applications

Article.ArticleTitle: Colorimetric detection of ozone in aqueous solution and imaging in living cells using a novel hemicyanine dye.

AbstractText: Ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) is ubiquitous in the environment and exposure to high levels of O<sub>3</sub> has been associated with various respiratory diseases, such as asthma, emphysema, and bronchitis. Therefore, it is necessary to develop a simple and efficient detection method for monitoring O<sub>3</sub> in the environment and living cells. In this study, an intramolecular charge-transfer (ICT) compound was designed and synthesized based on a phenol-type hemicyanine dye and 4-bromo-1-butene, which could specifically detect O<sub>3</sub> in aqueous solution. Due to the ICT process, the absorption spectrum, fluorescence spectrum, and color of the probe hemicyanine-butyl-3-enyl (HCB) changed significantly and thus the rapid and sensitive detection of O<sub>3</sub> was realized. The interaction between O<sub>3</sub> and the probe HCB could be completed within 40 min, and the detection limit of O<sub>3</sub> was as low as 2.15 × 10<sup>-7</sup> mol L<sup>-1</sup>. Finally, the proposed method was successfully applied to the visual detection of O<sub>3</sub> in a simulated O<sub>3</sub> environment and living cells.
